name: NewYorker
text:
The creation of the D.H.S. marked a shift in the way that Americans think and talk about the country, and about people: the nation used to protect itself against other nations, but now it had to fear individuals.
https://t.co/euI6JHsQBQ

name: NewYorker
text: "Racism alone could not explain what killed my mother," @KeeangaYamahtta writes. "It was the overlap of race, gender, and the aspirations to the comfort of a class that she poked around the edges of but could not ultimately break into." https://t.co/QLGcp3MKjE
